page.title: 05Dart Railway,Staverton
page.content: The Dart Valley Railway runs on a single line track between the depot at Buckfastleigh and Totnes. It was preserved by local enthusiasts after the threat of closure by the transport minister of the 1950's called Dr.Beeching.It carries thousands of tourists on the pictureque riverside route each year,the station at Staverton is a popular stopping point .However this year 1085 passengers travelled from Staverton.The round trip costs an adult Â£2.80 and a child Â£1.80 and takes about an hour.During the height of the tourist season in July and August there are 6 trains every day but there are trains running from Easter to September.The station has been used in films such as "Railway Children" and B.B.C. series "Lame Ducks"
